ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Patch Message
ygData.msgSnippet: Something you say?? Based on the history of Verant and our class.  I think you understated the problem.  I will never forget the great falling of 99 when they
ygData.messageBody:
Something you say?? Based on the history of Verant and our class. I think you understated the problem. I will never forget the great falling of 99 when they messed with spell chaincasting and bard song would not refresh. Ohh how many bards fell to their deaths that day. If anyone manages to get on and test please let us know how it goes.

My personal pet peeve here is they should post what songs no longer stack it's not like there is anyway we can know what the did not intend for us to do, and I would prefer not to die because I suddenly can't twist verses of celerity and chant of battle. Okay I wouldn't die but you folk know what I mean.

On Wed, 30 May 2001 15:42:36 +0200 eqbards@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> Cause it means that they have F***ed something up
>
> Musiker, bertox
> p.s. I like that they increased the duration on charm song tho :)
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Rebecca Small [mailto:rsmall@...]
> > Sent: 30. maj 2001 15:36
> > To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> > Subject: [eqbards] Patch Message
> >
> >
> > Why does this make my blood run cold?
> > ** Spell and Song Changes and Bug Fixes **
> >
> > - We've been fixing holes in the spell stacking code. For the
> > most part the
> > changes fix bugs that allowed tricks to get spells to stack
> > that were never
> > intended to stack.
> >
> > On the other hand, this is nice although I don't charm as
> > much as I used to.
> >
> > - Increased duration on Bard Charm songs to 18 seconds from
> > 12 seconds.
> >
> > Brilinnia Ban'Sidhe
> > Venator Sapentia, Xegony
> >
> >
> >
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> > lol@... with the subject submissions.
> >
> > Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to
> > http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
> >
> >
>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
> with the subject submissions.
>
